articles.title: The Fastest-Growing Brands In 2022: How Crocs, Apple, Zelle And More Stack Up Across Boomers, Gen Z, Gen X, Millennials
articles.content:
A new poll highlighted the fastest-growing brands based on awareness. The poll results were sorted by age demographic, which could help show which brands are bound to be popular in the future.
Here’s a look at the results.
What Happened: A new poll from Morning Consult showed the fastest-growing brands and companies based on user responses. The results were also broken down by age demographic and showed Crocs Inc (NASDAQ: CROX), shoes known for having holes in them, was gaining in popularity.
Fastest Growing Brands in 2022, overall:
1. Meta Platforms (NASDAQ: META)
2. Crocs
3. Beats by Dre, owned by Apple Inc (NASDAQ: AAPL)
4. SToK Cold Brew, owned by Danone (OTC: DANOY)
5. Milwaukee Tool, owned by Techtronic Industries Co. Ltd. (OTC: TTNDY)
6. Zelle, owned by several of the largest banks
7. Adobe Inc (NASDAQ: ADBE)
8. Great Value Cream Cheese, owned by Walmart Inc (NYSE: WMT)
9. Gatorade Fit, owned by PepsiCo (NYSE: PEP)
10. Office Depot, owned by ODP Corp (NASDAQ: ODP)
11. Chobani
12. T-Mobile (NASDAQ: TMUS)
13. Celsius Fitness Drinks (NASDAQ: CELH)
14. Google Sheets, owned by Alphabet Inc (NASDAQ: GOOG)(NASDAQ: GOOGL)
15. Major League Baseball
The Morning Consult also ranks the fastest-growing companies by age demographic, with the results shared below.
Gen Z:
1. Roku Inc (NASDAQ: ROKU)
2. Grand Theft Auto, video game from Take-Two Interactive Software, Inc (NASDAQ: ...

articles.title: Apple faces risk of ‘perishable demand’ for iPhones, analysts say
articles.content: Apple could simply see demand pushed back into 2023 — or some consumers could look at the long wait times and abandon their planned purchase altogether.

articles.title: Apple (AAPL) to Launch HomePod Mini in More Countries Globally
articles.content: Apple (AAPL) is launching HomePod mini across Europe and Africa to drive market share growth against stiff competition.

articles.title: Qualcomm Will Underperform Peers, Analyst Says Citing Decline In QCT Sales To Apple
articles.content:
Shares of Qualcomm Inc (NASDAQ: QCOM) have lost more than 36% year to date.
The stock is likely to continue trading at a discount to peers, especially due to the current weakness in the smartphone market, according to Wells Fargo.
The Analyst: Gary Mobley downgraded the rating for Qualcomm from Equal Weight to Underweight, while maintaining the price target at $105.
Check Out Other Analyst Ratings

articles.title: Apple agrees to let workers speak out about harassment and discrimination: 'This gives me a lot of hope for all laborers'
articles.content: Apple Inc. is promising to limit its use of nondisclosure agreements and clarifying its policies on employees' right to speak out in cases of discrimination and harassment after shareholders pressured the company about its practices.
